meanings.definition: To speak evil of; curse; slander.
meanings.sent1: She maledicts her enemies whenever they cross her path.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to maledict others behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: The witch would maledict the villagers for fun, but they never took her seriously.
meanings.sent4: His angry words seemed to maledict the very air around him.
meanings.sent5: The old legend tells of a powerful sorcerer who could maledict with just a whisper.

meanings.sent1: The maledict haunted the town, bringing misfortune to all who dared to enter.
meanings.sent2: She believed that the maledict placed upon her family was the cause of their troubles.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled nervously as they read the maledict written on the old scroll.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tome contained a maledict that was said to bring doom upon anyone who read it aloud.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence that followed the maledict seemed to chill the very bones of those present.
